channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Flytip, 17th November
item.description:
Next to the electrical boxes at the bottom of Chalkpit Avenue junction with Main Road there is a flytip of a broken up settee and 2 black bags of household rubbish can you please remove.Is it possible to put up a No Flytipping sign here as there is flytipping on a weekly basis.Thank You.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Chalk Pit Avenue, St Paul's Cray, Orpington, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uneven pavement. opposite 'The Stage Door' pub, 17th November
item.description:
Paving stones lifting because of tree roots,Kerbstones moved re tree roots, overgrown foilage at bottom of tree causing hazards to pedestrians, This has been there for a long time and never dealt with. Also fly tipping behind street box and loads of grafitti.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 30, Webber Street, Waterloo, London Borough of Lambeth

item.title: Ongoing issue with rubbish in front of OXFAM Container. Every day issue despite being "fixed" something needs to be done by the Council, 17th November
item.description:
I will continue to report until a permanent solution is made as currently being told that its "fixed" is not working given that every day the place is littered with rubbish, donations, household items, etc. The council has to do something that will works

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wilberforce Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A sunken and cracked drain cover is being struck hard by heavy vehicles, causing loud impacts and strong ground vibration in nearby houses, and needs inspecting and re-bedding., 17th November
item.description:
There is a damaged and sunken drain/manhole cover in the carriageway outside the Subud Centre. As shown in the photos, the tarmac around the cover is cracked and has sunk, leaving the cover sitting lower than the surrounding road surface. When heavy vehicles (especially buses and lorries which ther are many) drive over it, the cover makes a loud impact and sends a strong ground vibration through nearby buildings. We can clearly feel the vibration inside our home. The cracked and dropped surface suggests the frame may be loose or the bedding has deteriorated. This is likely to worsen and could become a hazard for vehicles, cyclists, and motorbikes.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 99, East Barnet Road, New Barnet, Chipping Barnet, London Borough of Barnet
Report on FixMyStreet
